articles.description: The Trump administration on Tuesday said that China has failed to alter its "unfair" practices at the heart of the U.S.-China trade conflict, adding to tensions ahead of a high-stakes meeting later this month between U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese Pr…

articles.author: Lauren Hirsch
articles.title: Campbell Soup's activist fight going down to the wire over two nominees
articles.description: Campbell Soup has pushed back against two of Third Point's nominees, former Campbell executive Bill Toler and Third Point executive Munib Islam. Third Point has nominated five executives for Campbell's board.
articles.content: The concern with Toler, Campbell said in a statement last week, arises from his work at Campbell, where he was employed between 1995 and 2000, according to LinkedIn. After Campbell, Toler worked at Pinnacle Foods and was CEO of Hostess Brands from 2014 throug… [+4068 chars]

articles.author: Michelle Fox
articles.title: Wells Fargo's Scott Wren dismisses risks: 'You need to be stepping in here and buying some stocks'
articles.description: Investors are concerned about three key risks but they may be worrying for nothing, says strategist Scott Wren.
articles.content: Investors are concerned about three key risks but they may be worrying for nothing, strategist Scott Wren told CNBC on Tuesday. div > div.group > p:first-child"> The questions of whether there will be a policy mistake by the Federal Reserve, whether … [+1538 chars]

articles.author: Amanda Macias
articles.title: Pentagon estimates troops deployed at southwest border will cost $72 million
articles.description: The movement of thousands of active-duty troops to the border has been criticized as a political stunt designed to back Trump's campaign promise of securing U.S. ports of entry.  Defense Secretary James Mattis downplayed that criticism last month saying that …
articles.content: WASHINGTON The Pentagon estimates that the cost of the 5,900 troops deployed to the southwest border will total $72 million, spokesman U.S. Army Col. Rob Manning said in a statement Monday. div > div.group > p:first-child"> In mid-October, a caravan … [+817 chars]

articles.author: Eustance Huang
articles.title: Australian stocks fall on the back of overnight plunge on Wall Street
articles.description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average plunged more than 500 points on Wall Street overnight, erasing its gains for 2018.
articles.content: In the oil markets, crude prices nosedived by nearly 7 percent on Tuesday after seeing four days of gains. U.S. West Texas Intermediate settled Tuesday's session lower by $3.77, or 6.6 percent, at $53.43. The contract fell as low as $52.77 on Tuesday, its wea… [+776 chars]
